amendment.description: Amendment sought to provide that the Federal Government would not have to pay compensation for losses in property value caused by wetlands regulation in cases where failure to enforce such regulations is likely to reduce the fair market value of one or more private homes by $10,000 or more.
amendment.purpose: An amendment (printed as amendment No. 55 in the Congressional Record of May 9) to deny compensation to affected landowners for any agency "takings" action for losses in property value caused by wetlands regulations if the failure to enforce those regulations would reduce the fair market value of other private homes by $10,000 or more.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Wyden amendment (A036) Failed by recorded vote: 158 - 270 (Roll no. 335).
